p: For the quantification of virus in whitefly whole body and organs, all real time data were calculated using 2 -△Ct as normalized to whitefly actin. For the comparison of transmission efficiency and quantity of virus, normal distribution tests were performed prior to analysis, and then Kruskal-Wallis test was used for analysis of significance. All data were presented as the mean ± standard errors of mean (mean ± SEM). The differences were considered significant when P < 0.05. All statistical analyses in the present study were undertaken using SPSS 20.0 Statistics and EXCEL.
